EmoteActions.Message: Aun Hareltah bows respectfully.
"I greet you, mighty %s. You have slain the queen, and granted us relief from the affliction of Wharu. The Aun xuta owes a debt of gratitude to you, as yet unpaid."
"Let me examine the head of that accused beast, and I shall reward you as is proper."
ChampionKillQuest2@Use
Aun Hareltah cocks his head to the side, as if listening to something inaudible.

"Wind has brought tidings of your deeds, friend. She whispers, '%s has slain the brutal Temepuh, who calls himself Temenua as he hunts your people on the upland. Temenua, who sheds your xuta's blood at the behest of the soulless atua ngamaru.'"

"This deed is a fiery blaze upon your keh, Isparian, even if you know it not. Should you desire the Stave of Palenqual, give me Temepuh's totem. Now we are pressed, and it is time for us to release the magic of Tonk."

"But if you do not desire this magical stave, if you would rather have the ranged kalindan or the fighting staff called hoeroa, hold your hand for now. I will only reward you once for the butcher's death."
RingQuest02@Use
RingQuest03@Use
RingQuest04@Use
RingQuest05@Use
RingQuest06@Use
Aun Hareltah glances at you sharply.
I do not know your name, and thanks to your people, Wharu's children have overrun the whole of Palenqual. I do not have the time to chat with tourists. Make your name known to me, and we will talk.
Aun Hareltah looks at you quizzically.

"But, %s, you have already claimed the bounty of Temepuh's name. Does not the totem of Palenqual serve you well? Please, use it to hunt and kill our enemies, before we are driven in to Timaru herself!"
Hrm... so you claim to have slain Temepuh?
Aun Hareltah places the totem in the palm of his hand, and closes his eyes. After a brief moment, he shakes his head and hands the totem back to you.
No, I fear you are attempting to deceive me. Your keh would sing of this victory quite plainly - it does not. You should return this to the one who actually killed the scourge of the uplands.
Aun Hareltah looks at the egg in shock.

How can you bring this into Timaru at such a time? This is a very dangerous thing to have in one's possession at any moment, but when Wharu's power is at its height, it may draw his children here! I will dispose of it, and be glad I do not have the Nualuan run you out.
%s, bloodied and battered after the battle in the Royal Hive, presents the stern Aun Hareltah with the head of the Olthoi Queen.
The Tah of Aun holds the head of the Queen before him, and bows in respect to the might of Wharu.
"Great anima of decay," he intones solemnly, "bear no ill will towards %s, who slew your servant respectfully."
"From this point forward, %s shall be known and honored among all Aun as Queenslayer."
"Further," Hareltah says with a smile, "%s shall be known as my adopted kin!"
He pulls the startled %s into a warm embrace, as the Aun whisper among themselves. "...not of Tonk!" Aun Dreganaua is heard to protest.

"You have saved this xuta," Hareltah says gravely, his powerful voice carrying over the susurrations of the crowd. "For this, for all your experiences on the path to defeating the Queen, the hardest road known in these strange lands, I recognize you."
MaraeFinalReward
%s's party has been granted forty million experience points!

"Finally," Hareltah says, "there is the matter of this totem in my hands. I will prepare it for you with my own hands, my kin, that you may hang from your wall. With its power, your house shall be mighty among Tonk and Isparian, and none shall wash the earth from under it."
Aun Hareltah embraces %s again with tears in his eyes, and returns the head of the queen.
"Hrm... so you claim to have slain the spawn of Wharu?"
Aun Hareltah lays his hand lightly on the Queen's head, and closes his eyes. After a brief moment, he shakes his head and gently pushes it back towards you.
"Your keh would sing of this victory quite plainly - it does not. Give this to the one who struck the killing blow, %s, and let me reward them directly."
"My apologies if you also grappled with Wharu, but I would not wish to reward one who merely found such a thing."
Aun Hareltah turns the tessera over in his hands, but shakes his head regretfully.
I am sorry. You have already gained five skill points from the tesserae. I can teach you nothing more.

Aun Hareltah looks around his town grimly.
Aun Hareltah regards the totem gravely.

This is a work of Aun magic. You say you took this from a Hea? I have little wonder. This is a Totem of Tanae, the Forest, who wraps the world in his green arms, whispers deep wisdoms, and, on our world of Ezheret-Hazahtu, shelters our people from the great sisters Wind and Rain, as they eternally grapple for the love of Father Sea.

This is the handicraft of Aun Shimauri. You may find him at the base of the plateau, to the east of Timaru. I charge you who have recovered this great medicine to bring it to Shimauri. May Wind, as she winds her paths about the world, speed you there.
Aun Hareltah regards the totem gravely.

This is a work of Aun magic. You say you took this from a Hea? I have little wonder. This is a Totem of Audetaunga, the Mountain, she who stands proud and immovable, tempering even her great and fickle daughter spirits Wind and Rain.

This is the handicraft of Aun Shimauri. You may find him at the base of the plateau, to the east of Timaru. I charge you who have recovered this great medicine to bring it to Shimauri. May Wind, as she winds her paths about the world, speed you there.
Aun Hareltah regards the totem gravely.

This is a work of Aun magic. You say you took this from a Hea? I have little wonder. This is a Totem of Volkama, the River, son of Sea. It is Volkama who travels between Mother Mountain and Father Sea. It is he who tempers his father's great power such that Tanae and Tonk may sing and drum under Hazahtu.

This is the handicraft of Aun Shimauri. You may find him at the base of the plateau, to the east of Timaru. I charge you who have recovered this great medicine to bring it to Shimauri. May Wind, as she winds her paths about the world, speed you there.
ChampionKillQuest2@GiveTotem
MaraeFinalReward@GiveEgg
InvasionQuest08@GiveHead
You are honored among the Aun as Queenslayer. Now may your own people honor you as well.
Aun Hareltah turns the Timaru Totem over in his hands.
Are you sure you wish to trade Aun Kahmaula's boon in to me? Very well, then. I grant you knowledge.
Hareltah lightly taps your forehead.

MaraeFinalReward@Use
Aun Hareltah strides forward to embrace you, but he does not smile, and his voice is taught with tension.

"I greet you, honored kin. I am glad for your coming. Wharu rises across the plateau, and we are pressed. All our stones have been broken by the Ispar xuta, and Wind whispers that the insects are brooding a new queen."
"I fear we may need your assistance once more, Queenslayer %s. You will help us, yes?"
The Tah of Aun gazes deep into your eyes, his hand clutching at your arm like a lifeline.
HareltahKill1@Use
Aun Hareltah nods at you briefly.
"Ah, %s. The slayer of Temepuh, who hunted our people at the behest of the atua ngamaru."

"I trust the Totem of Palenqual serves you well? Wharu rises, and we require its service. His children skitter across this land in increasing numbers. Now is the time for all Aun, and all friends of Aun, to stand against him."
"For my people, this is divine mandate. From what I have heard of your Elysa, called saint by some, it should be for the Ispar xuta as well."
Aun Hareltah regards you with some respect.
"Yes... your name has been mentioned to me. You are %s, who aided Aun Kahmaula by repairing the northernmost of the stone circles."

"I only wish your efforts had not been obviated by others of your xuta. Wharu is free across the whole upland Palenqual. It is not safe beyond these walls, though the Aun xuta would be grateful for your help in this holy war."
Aun Hareltah regards you with some respect.
"Yes... your name has been mentioned to me. You are %s, who aided Aun Gehaua by repairing the northeastern stone circle."

"I only wish your efforts had not been obviated by others of your xuta. Wharu is free across the whole upland Palenqual. It is not safe beyond these walls, though the Aun xuta would be grateful for your help in this holy war."
Aun Hareltah regards you with some respect.
"Yes... your name has been mentioned to me. You are %s, who aided Aun Tanaua by repairing the southeastern stone circle."

"I only wish your efforts had not been obviated by others of your xuta. Wharu is free across the whole upland Palenqual. It is not safe beyond these walls, though the Aun xuta would be grateful for your help in this holy war."
Aun Hareltah regards you with some respect.
"Yes... your name has been mentioned to me. You are %s, who aided Aun Laiaua by repairing the southwestern stone circle."

"I only wish your efforts had not been obviated by others of your xuta. Wharu is free across the whole upland Palenqual. It is not safe beyond these walls, though the Aun xuta would be grateful for your help in this holy war."
Aun Hareltah regards you with some respect.
"Yes... your name has been mentioned to me. You are %s, who aided Aun Aanaua by repairing the northwestern stone circle."

I only wish your efforts had not been obviated by others of your xuta. Wharu is free across the whole upland Palenqual. It is not safe beyond these walls, though the Aun xuta would be grateful for your help in this holy war."
HareltahKill1@GiveTotem
Aun Hareltah looks at the totem sadly.
"Ah, Temepuh. Too many of our people have fallen at the hands of your brutal raiders.
The Tah of Aun tucks the totem into his medicine pouch, and looks you in the eye.
"Later, I will join Temenpuh's power to my buadren, that he may in death redeem his life. But now I will reward you, with that thing most precious to the Aun."
"This is the Stave of Palenqual - the living totem of this island itself, given to us by spirits of this place who call themselves Deru. It may be turned into a powerful force for good or ill."
"But you have difficult choices to make before it will serve you, %s. My note will explain."
Aun Hareltah regards the egg warily.
It is a very dangerous thing to have in one's possession, blood as my blood. Still, do as you think is best, Queenslayer. I will support you.
MaraeFinalReward@GiveHead
Aun Hareltah looks at you in frank amazement.
"Gracious, %s! My kin, you never cease to amaze me. To have slain such a creature more than once! It is beyond me. But I cannot reward you with more than I already have."
"Here, let me prepare this totem for your wall as well, and reaffirm your status as Queenslayer."
Aun Hareltah turns the tessera over in his hands, and nods briefly.
It is well. I grant you knowledge.
He lightly taps your forehead.
You have gained a point of Alchemy skill!
